commit_message:
Add min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I2fb34e77ecd3465aea37448f82c4f31a9fa58872

commit_message:
Add neutron-aci-plugin spec

This specification document describes the changes to existing charms and
new charms required to support Neutron ACI plugin for OpenStack.

Change-Id: Ied3c1ec37ae1da54685f4844e775d62686e9a6f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-specs refs/changes/40/656240/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Copyright 2017 Canonical UK This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: "None". For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html =============================== Cisco ACI plugin for Openstack =============================== Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) is a data center software-defined networking (SDN) solution that provides centralized, policy-based fabric management and integrated multitenant network virtualization. The Cisco Application Policy Infrastructure Controller (APIC) is the heart and brains of the Cisco ACI solution. Cisco APIC offers a single, robust and well documented API to programmatically control all aspects of the system. Cisco provides a supported and open-sourced Neutron plug-in for Cisco APIC to leverage a Cisco ACI fabric as the back end to implement networking for OpenStack clouds. The Cisco ACI plug-in for OpenStack brings many benefits for both OpenStack and fabric administrators in terms of performance, high availability, visibility and simplified operations. Problem Description =================== Aci plugin support requires installation of packages in units running neutron-api, nova-compute, neutron-gateway and openstack-dashboard. Plugin requires additional services to be running on units running neutron-api, neutron-gateway and nova-compute. L3 services are provided by aci plugin, which requires that neutron router should not be active. Also while openvswitch libraries are needed to run opflex processes to run on nova-compute and neutron-gateway units, but openvswitch processes should not be active. Aci installation starts neutron-metadata agents on compute nodes, there by requiring neutron-metadata-agent on neutron-gateway unit to inactive. Aci plugin, requires modifying the common /etc/neutron/neutron.conf and /etc/neutron/dhcp_agent.ini files. Other configurations are contained in plugin specific configuration files. Proposed Change =============== It is proposed that minimal changes are made to existing charms and also the changes are active only when the neutron plugin is specified as 'aci'. Aci plugin for neutron requires changes to charmhelpers, neutron-api, neutron-gateway to introduce a new plugin 'aci'. The support also requires new charms 1. **neutron-api-plugin-aci**, a subordinate charm to neutron-api 2. **neutron-aci-opflex**, a subordinate charm to nova-compute and neutron-gateway 3. **openstack-dashboard-plugin-gbp**, a subordinate charm to openstack-dashboard. Cisco releases aci plugin debian files at regular intervals. The proposed way to install or update is that user creates a apt repository, which is reachable by the nodes during openstack installation. The charms provide a configuration option to specify the apt source, which gets added during installation. The changes proposed will work from Openstack newton version and above. The changes are being developed and tested with juju version 2.5.4-xenial-amd64. Alternatives ------------ none Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: rkolli Gerrit Topic ------------ Use Gerrit topic "aci" for all patches related to this spec. .. code-block:: bash git-review -t aci Work Items ---------- The changes required for implementation are ready and tested. It has been in use by customers from private git repositories. The effort is to upstream the changes. Repositories ------------ This will require to create the following new git repositories charm-neutron-api-plugin-aci, charm-neutron-aci-opflex, charm-openstack-dashboard-plugin-gbp The following charm repoistories will be involved directly. charm-neutron-api, charm-neutron-gateway, charm-helpers Documentation ------------- This should not require any changes to existing charm documentation. The documentation for installation of aci plugin will be created by Cisco and available on cisco web site. Security -------- Currently we support use case where the apt repository for aci packages can be unsigned. Based on feedback we can limit it only signed repositories. Testing ------- Testing requires Cisco ACI hardware. For now testing will be done by Cisco for all releases. It will be made sure that changes to common charms are effective only when the neutron plugin values is specified as aci. Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
User friendly message for non pristine disks

The first 2048 bytes must be all zeros.
But the user is not told why the charm is ignoring the disk.
The charm just that states that its not pristine.

This leaves the user with having to look through the
code and find this method, to determine why its ignoring the disk.

An additional log message here to help the user determine how to clear
the disk properly

Change-Id: Ifd70dd1fddb065b2689acf448426b65161467a03
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd refs/changes/04/656504/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # for the unfortunate soles that think # dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sdX bs=512 count=1 # is sufficient to clear mbr and partiition table # and the wonder why ceph-osd complains the disk is not pristine ret = all(byte == 0x0 for byte in data) if ret != true: log('The first 2048 bytes of ({}) must be all zeros,' 'skipping disk'.format(dev), level=WARNING) return ret
deleted_lines: return all(byte == 0x0 for byte in data)

added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from charms.reactive import RelationBase from charms.reactive import hook from charms.reactive import scopes class KeystoneProvides(RelationBase): scope = scopes.GLOBAL @hook('{provides:keystone-admin}-relation-joined') def joined(self): self.set_state('{relation_name}.connected') @hook('{provides:keystone-admin}-relation-changed') def changed(self): self.set_state('{relation_name}.available') @hook('{provides:keystone-admin}-relation-{broken,departed}') def broken_departed(self): self.remove_state('{relation_name}.database.joined') self.remove_state('{relation_name}.available') @hook('{provides:keystone-admin}-relation-broken') def broken(self): self.set_state('{relation_name}.removed') def publish_info(self, service_hostname, service_port, service_username, service_password, service_tenant_name, service_region, api_version, service_project_domain_name, service_project_name, service_protocol, service_user_domain_name): """ Publish keystone admin credentials keystone provides: {u'service_password': u'XXXXXXXX', u'service_port': u'5000', u'private-address': u'10.XX.XX.XXX', u'service_hostname': u'10.XX.XX.XXX', u'service_username': u'admin', u'service_tenant_name': u'Admin', u'service_region': u'RegionOne'} keystone v3 also provides {api_version: "3" service_project_domain_name: admin_domain service_project_name: admin service_protocol: http service_user_domain_name: admin_domain} """ convs = self.conversations() if len(convs) > 0: conv = convs[0] conv.set_remote('service_hostname', service_hostname) conv.set_remote('service_port', service_port) conv.set_remote('service_username', service_username) conv.set_remote('service_password', service_password) conv.set_remote('service_tenant_name', service_tenant_name) conv.set_remote('service_region', service_region) if api_version > 2: conv.set_remote('api_version', api_version) conv.set_remote('service_user_domain_name', service_user_domain_name) conv.set_remote('service_project_domain_name', service_project_domain_name) conv.set_remote('service_project_name', service_project_name) conv.set_remote('service_protocol', service_protocol)

commit_message:
Fixed check_ceph_status nagios plugin

- fixed comparing float with string (degraded_ratio and  misplaced_ratio).

- fixed checking recovery rate, we only do this when there's degraded
  or misplaced PGs.

- fixed to exit correctly on warning.

- fixed warning status when we're ignoring the nodeep-scrub flag

Change-Id: I05c9495953a8522761037b29f0e0ef52caa580ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-mon refs/changes/78/610878/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: degraded_ratio = float(status_data['pgmap'].get('degraded_ratio', 0.0)) if degraded_ratio > 0: status_msg.append("Degraded ratio: {}".format(degraded_ratio)) misplaced_ratio = float(status_data['pgmap'].get('misplaced_ratio', 0.0)) if misplaced_ratio > 0: status_msg.append("Misplaced ratio: {}".format(misplaced_ratio)) recovering = float(status_data['pgmap'].get('recovering_objects_per_sec', 0)) # We only check recovering rate when the cluster has degraded or misplaced PGs if (degraded_ratio > 0 or misplaced_ratio > 0) and recovering < args.recovery_rate: if recovering > 0: if overall_status == 'HEALTH_WARN' and status_msg: exitcode = 'warning'
deleted_lines: degraded_ratio = status_data['pgmap'].get('degraded_ratio', 0.0) status_msg.append("Degraded ratio: {}".format(degraded_ratio)) misplaced_ratio = status_data['pgmap'].get('misplaced_ratio', 0.0) status_msg.append("Misplaced ratio: {}".format(misplaced_ratio)) recovering = status_data['pgmap'].get('recovering_objects_per_sec', 0.0) if recovering < args.recovery_rate: if overall_status == 'HEALTH_WARN': exitcode = 'critical'

commit_message:
WIP -- Add migration-via-tls spec.

DON'T merge; in progress.

Change-Id: I94fa3354b225c5d3d1f750ad5f108353398b4695
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-specs refs/changes/40/675740/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Copyright 2019 Canonical Limited This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: "None". For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ========================================== Secure live migration with QEMU-native TLS ========================================== Secure live migration makes use of the "QEMU-native TLS" feature in libvirt 4.4.0 and QEMU 2.11.0 (or later). It ensures that all of the migration data is sent over a TLS-encrypted streams using a PKI infrastructure. It is much faster, and uses less CPU resources. It does **not** remove the need for having passwordless SSH configured for each of the hosts as the nova-compute payload still needs to commuicate with remote hosts directly to configure things such as directories, etc. See `Secure live migration with QEMU-native TLS`__ for more details. .. __: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/secure-live-migration-with-qemu-native-tls.html .. note:: This does not solve the issue of migrating between nova-compute instances that are on different nova-cloud-controller (Juju) applications. e.g. bug `1468871 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/charms/+source/nova-cloud-controller/+bug/>`_ That will still require solving for the SSH key distribution between multiple nova-cloud-controller applications (not just units of a single application). Problem Description =================== From the linked document above: The encryption offered by nova’s libvirt.live_migration_tunnelled does not secure all the different migration streams of a nova instance, namely: guest RAM, device state, and disks (via NBD) when using non-shared storage. Further, the “tunnelling via libvirtd” has inherent limitations: (a) it cannot handle live migration of disks in a non-shared storage setup (a.k.a. “block migration”); and (b) has a huge performance overhead and latency, because it burns more CPU and memory bandwidth due to increased number of data copies on both source and destination hosts. To solve this existing limitation, QEMU and libvirt have gained (refer below for version details) support for “native TLS”, i.e. TLS built into QEMU. This will secure all data transports, including disks that are not on shared storage, without incurring the limitations of the “tunnelled via libvirtd” transport. To take advantage of the “native TLS” support in QEMU and libvirt, nova has introduced new configuration attribute libvirt.live_migration_with_native_tls. .. note:: Password-less SSH keys must still be provided (as with the original tunnelled migration), so that nova on one host can perform changes on another host directly. This still appears to be a hard requirement. The feature described in thos specification change is to make migrations more efficient and faster, using less CPU resources, and more importantly, to increase the security of the migration across (potentially) untrusted networks. Proposed Change =============== Here is where you cover the change you propose to make in detail. How do you propose to solve this problem? The `QEMU-native TLS`_ document provides the following prerequisites: .. _QEMU-native TLS: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/secure-live-migration-with-qemu-native-tls.html 1. Version requirement: This feature needs at least libvirt 4.4.0 and QEMU 2.11. 2. A pre-configured TLS environment—i.e. CA, server, and client certificates, their file permissions, et al—must be “correctly” configured (typically by an installer tool) on all relevant compute nodes. To simplify your PKI (Public Key Infrastructure) setup, use deployment tools that take care of handling all the certificate lifecycle management. For example, refer to the “TLS everywhere” guide from the TripleO project. 3. Password-less SSH setup for all relevant compute nodes. 4. On all relevant compute nodes, ensure the TLS-related config attributes in /etc/libvirt/qemu.conf are in place So one issue is that as SSH keys must be distributed to all nova-compute units, this does **not** solve the issues around hook execution times on the nova-cloud-controller when it is distributing keys to all of the nova-compute units. Also, a PKI solution needs to be set up whereby the nova-compute units need to have a TLS certificate, and the TLS certificate needs to have a common CA across all of the nova-compute units. The obviously solution is to use Vault to keep the CA, and issue the certificates to the nova-compute units on demand over a (new) tls-certificates interface. This will be supported on Ubuntu 19.04 and later. It will become the default on Ubuntu 20.04 This will be supported on OpenStack ``stein`` and later. This will be supported on the 2.x series of Juju. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Name: Alex Kavanagh Launchpad ID: ajkavanagh IRC: tinwood Gerrit Topic ------------ Use Gerrit topic "nova-tls-migration" for all patches related to this spec. .. code-block:: bash git-review -t nova-tls-migration Work Items ---------- Work items or tasks -- break the feature up into the things that need to be done to implement it. Those parts might end up being done by different people, but we're mostly trying to understand the timeline for implementation. //here Repositories ------------ Will any new git repositories need to be created? Identify all new charm repos, interface repos, layer repos, whether new or existing, which will be affected or involved directly in the work which is defined by this spec. Documentation ------------- Will this require a documentation change? If so, which documents? Will it impact developer workflow? Will additional communication need to be made? Identify the surface area of doc updates explicitly, ie. charm-guide, deployment-guide, charm README, wiki page links. Security -------- Does this introduce any additional security risks, or are there security-related considerations which should be discussed? Testing ------- What tests will be available or need to be constructed in order to validate this? Unit/functional tests, development environments/servers, etc. Are there any special hardware requirements to test this? Dependencies ============ - Include specific references to specs and/or stories, or in other projects, that this one either depends on or is related to. - Does this feature require any new library or program dependencies not already in use? - What are the plans to package and distribute the payload and/or dependencies?

commit_message:
Gracefully handle empty volume group

If there's no volume in the volume group at all, then
it's safe to assume that non-existing volume is not
an active bluestore device.

commit_message:
[TEST] Test Ubuntu Fan Networking in UOSCI

At this point in time just a test to reveal which value
juju chooses for fan-config when run in UOSCI.

Will use this PR to add the LXD bundles back as gate bundles
as soon as we have the corrensponding ubuntu-fan configuration
set up on our test executors.

Change-Id: I40192c70c928074ec103e971dcdebfb85b4f0515

Check for apache pid on service restart

For openstack services fronted by apache WSGI, we need to check
for correct apache process restart in containerized environments
where there are more than one apache container

Closes-Bug: #1795918

New spec for adding image catalog management to the glance charm.

Change-Id: Ib1d6c5dad02429b446135c1014e767fda0a90d01
'}]
commit_message:
Added glance image management spec

New spec for adding image catalog management to the glance charm.

Change-Id: Ib1d6c5dad02429b446135c1014e767fda0a90d01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-specs refs/changes/87/557787/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Copyright 2018 Canonical Ltd. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: "None". For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ======================= Glance Image Management ======================= Canonical's official way of managing the Glance image catalog in a Juju deployed OpenStack cloud is to deploy the glance-simplestreams-sync charm (https://jujucharms.com/glance-simplestreams-sync/). This charm will download predominantly Ubuntu images based on a simplestreams (https://launchpad.net/simplestreams) feed and keep those images synchronised on a configurable schedule. This spec proposes developing such functionality within the glance charm (https://jujucharms.com/glance/) itself and adding further required features based on experience with deployments. The glance-simplestreams-sync charm would be deprecated in the future if this work is fulfilled. Problem Description =================== The glance-simplestreams-sync charm was written in 2014 and has mostly been in a state of maintenance since. It has a number of known issues: * Separate charm (as opposed to functionality being in the glance charm). * No HA functionality. * Race conditions with full OpenStack deployment. * Keystone v2 support only. * No functional tests. * AGPL licensed (unlike Apache 2.0 licensed OpenStack charms). Developing the same functionality within the glance charm will offer an opportunity to address the above issues whilst also rebooting development of image management features. Proposed Change =============== The glance charm will be developed to support image catalog management with the following key features: * Image catalog management will be Juju action controlled. * 'add-simplestreams-source' action for adding a simplestreams image source. Parameters: * name (for reference) * url * name-prefix * path * max * yaml array of item filters * user-agent * hypervisor-mapping * image-prefix (prefixed to each image name within the catalog) * sync-schedule (specify how often this source should be synchronised) Majority of parameters are equivalent to their glance-simplestreams-sync ones. image-prefix would default to '<source name>/' if omitted. An empty string could be specified if the user doesn't require a prefix. sync-schedule could be 'hourly', 'daily', 'weekly', a cron like expression or omitted to disable scheduled synchronisation. * 'list-sources' action for listing current image sources. Results should include the next synchronisation time per source (if active and scheduled). * 'remove-source' action for removing an image source. Parameters: * name * 'sync-source' action for immediate image source synchronisation. Parameters: * name If name is omitted synchronise all image sources. * 'update-source' action for updating an image source. Parameters: * active * sync-schedule * name active indicates whether a source is enabled/disabled. If name is omitted, alter all sources. Further parameters permitted for updating can be added later like 'item-filters' (simplestreams source) or 'image-prefix' (generic). If a particular source type doesn't support a parameter it can be ignored (or raise an error if 'name' is also specified). Further 'add-<source type>-source' actions could be added later to support adding image sources other than simplestreams, say a simple URL source. A failing source (probably due to network problems) should be retried several times automatically and subsequently made inactive. The user can reactivate later using 'update-source' action. When removing a source, care needs to be take not to remove images in use breaking live migration. A 'force' parameter on the 'remove-source' action could be used to force removal anyway. Proxy support will be required. 'content_id_template' and 'image-modifier' functionality from glance-simplestreams-sync will need to be looked at during development to see where that should fit in within this design. * Updating of Juju status output to report image sources state. * No. of image sources. * How many images downloaded / requested per image source. * Next synchronisation poll (if using scheduled sync). * Total GB/MB/kB downloaded / requested (during synchronisation). * Rate of download (during synchronisation). A large chunk of this will be iterating on what looks good in practise. * Juju leadership elections will be used to manage multiple deployed glance units (HA). * Only the leader glance unit will perform image catalog functions. * Should the leader fail, the newly elected leader will take over image catalog management. Alternatives ------------ We could do active feature development on the glance-simplestreams-sync charm. However since release 1.24 (2015), Juju now supports actions, service leader and status update features. These features allow image management to be properly supported within the glance charm so there's little motivation for maintaining a separate charm. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: None Gerrit Topic ------------ Use Gerrit topic "glance-image-management" for all patches related to this spec. .. code-block:: bash git-review -t glance-image-management Work Items ---------- glance charm * Add image catalog actions. * Implement Juju status updating. * Implement HA handling. * Add unit and functional tests. * Testing! * Update README OpenStack bundles * Update bundle READMEs to describe how to subsequently sync images in a deployed cloud. Addtionally, the glance-simplestreams-sync charm should be marked deprecated as mentioned in the Documentation section. Repositories ------------ https://github.com/openstack/charm-glance Documentation ------------- The OpenStack Charms release notes can be used to document upgrading from glance-simplestreams-sync deployments. glance-simplestreams-sync charm should be marked deprecated in its README and noted in the release notes. The following documentation may require updating: * OpenStack Charms Deployment Guide (https://docs.openstack.org/charm-deployment-guide/latest/) Security -------- None Testing ------- Unit and functional tests will need to be written for the glance charm in order to verify the work. Unit tests exist for glance-simplestreams-sync which may be usable. Dependencies ============ - Depends on simplestreams bzr revision 449 or later for Keystone v3 support. 0.1.0~bzr459-0ubuntu1 is the version currently packaged for Bionic and will be SRU'ed to Xenial.

Allow local SSL certificate and key without local CA.

Add support for local SSL certificate and key that are signed by a public
CA and do not require installation of a custom CA.

commit_message:
Disable cephadm when ceph is deployed

After ceph is deployed, which means day1 operations are over
and the Ceph cluster daemons are up && running, cephadm can
be paused by running the 'disable_cephadm' playbook.

Change-Id: I5952bb8a7a327e37a39acc95751cd5746fd9a41d

commit_message:
Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache

This change removes direct reference to some classes in
puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

- The api class doesn't need access to anything defined in
  apache::params

- The following classes are included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
  resource type, and current inclusions are just redundant.

Change-Id: Ie0c61d21b5a64210c79765dc3ebd3c39d4d98c5d

commit_message:
Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache

This change removes direct reference to some classes in
puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

- The api class doesn't need access to anything defined in
  apache::params

- The following classes are included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
  resource type, and current inclusions are just redundant.

Change-Id: I513d815b8b44f17b002a7904499ec82f1acf6614

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix default thin_provisioned volumes on AFF

The NetApp ONTAP driver was creating thin provisioned volumes on
AFF systems even when the thin provisioned extra spec was saying
the contrary.

ONTAP AFF systems create thin provisioned volumes by default, which
differs from FAS systems, that creates thick provisioned volumes by
default.

The NetApp ONTAP driver was modified to fix this misbehavior.

Change-Id: I9218bf0d7cb607dd75e892ce86af958d43a7fcdb
Closes-Bug: #1929421

commit_message:
Add support for the interface parameter in authtoken middleware

This patch adds support for [keystone_authtoken] interface parameter,
so that operators can define which endpoint should be used by authtoken
middleware.

Change-Id: Iebb67609a384ee4c6be1d0f8aff86643ff6775c2
(cherry picked from commit a09758194acee428f793abb975fdd92affcb2314)
(cherry picked from commit 263240ea845b4cc96b8e82e6fa884005023fe78f)

added_lines: --- features: - | The new ``swift::proxy::authtoken::interface`` parameter has been added, which can be used to set the interface parameter in authtoken middleware.

commit_message:
Fix wrong key to look up domain parameters from puppet.conf

... and refactor the logic to ensure credentials are picked up from
the correct section.

commit_message:
Add support for the interface parameter in authtoken middleware

This patch adds support for [keystone_authtoken] interface parameter,
so that operators can define which endpoint should be used by authtoken
middleware.

commit_message:
Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache

This change removes direct reference to some classes in
puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

- The api class doesn't need access to anything defined in
  apache::params

- The following classes are included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
  resource type, and current inclusions are just redundant.

commit_message:
Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache

This change removes direct reference to some classes in
puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

- The api class doesn't need access to anything defined in
  apache::params

- The following classes are included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
  resource type, and current inclusions are just redundant.

Dependencies defined in neutron::wsgi::apache are removed and loosen
to avoid direct deference to resources from puppetlabs-apache. When
httpd is used to run neutron-api, the neutron-service tag is added to
the httpd service, so that it is started during service phase.

Change-Id: I1a17a5ac990dd8e0a166b7d78b8a58a4b1055502

commit_message:
Re-run repo-setup in image/container run plays after pre mirror setup

In RDO jobs the mirror-info-fork is included after the repo-setup
role. This means we don't have NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR available
in /etc/ci/mirror_info.sh and we use mirror.stream.centos.org
which is proving unreliable eg 404 for 9-stream/AppStream [1].

This patch re-runs the repo-setup role in the run plays for
containers and image builds. The mirror-info-fork is run in pre so
this way NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR is available when we do repo-setup
e.g. mirror used at [2]

[1] https://logserver.rdoproject.org/67/36267/36/check/periodic-tripleo-ci-build-containers-centos-9-push-master/575a6f3/logs/container-builds/c9967fc5-5f3b-4c06-b93b-eff2cd775c84/base/os/manila-base/manila-base-build.log
[2] https://logserver.rdoproject.org/17/36817/13/check/periodic-tripleo-centos-9-buildimage-overcloud-hardened-uefi-full-master/d4e06e9/yum.repos.d/quickstart-centos-appstreams.repo

Co-Authored-By: Douglas Viroel <viroel@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibb5617c84b7a31a320aebecc82d980ba8e9751b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/50/820850/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Rerun repo-setup role after mirror setup for c9 when: ansible_distribution_major_version is version('9', '>=') include_role: name: repo-setup vars: repo_setup_dir: "{{ workspace }}" repo_setup_use_collections: false

commit_message:
Add support for the interface parameter in authtoken middleware

This patch adds support for [keystone_authtoken] interface parameter,
so that operators can define which endpoint should be used by authtoken
middleware.

Change-Id: I86a9f29551cc8efc672f4c983a87a66a403db343
(cherry picked from commit 24390a98f0e24af0fd4740e0afb0e5c83c9ae602)

added_lines: --- features: - | The new ``mistral::keystone::authtoken::interface`` parameter has been added, which can be used to set the interface parameter in authtoken middleware.

commit_message:
early return for _share_replica_update() if there is no active replica

If the parent share of the replica has no active replica,
this is an error situation where _share_replica_update() simply
returns and logs a warning if the replica being acted on has not
been already in error state itself before.

Change-Id: I9bdbbaafba413fa4b2a783130fd58a4b6c2cea4b
Partial-Bug: #1924230
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/58/786658/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _active_replica = next((x for x in replica_list if x['replica_state'] == constants.REPLICA_STATE_ACTIVE), None) if _active_replica is None: if share_replica['replica_state'] != constants.STATUS_ERROR: # only log warning if replica_state was not already in error msg = (("Replica parent share %(id)s has no active " "replica.") % {'id': share_replica['share_id']}) LOG.warning(msg) self.db.share_replica_update(context, share_replica['id'], {'replica_state': constants.STATUS_ERROR}) # without a related active replica, we cannot act on any # non-active replica return
deleted_lines: _active_replica = [x for x in replica_list if x['replica_state'] == constants.REPLICA_STATE_ACTIVE][0]

subject: Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-12-08 14:06:22.000000000', 'files': ['metadata.json', 'manifests/wsgi/apache.pp', 'manifests/api.pp', 'spec/classes/mistral_wsgi_apache_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-mistral/commit/237975b73a3576c177c2733c82fb660b736d593a', 'message': "Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache

This change removes direct reference to some classes in
puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

- The api class doesn't need access to anything defined in
  apache::params

- The following classes are included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
  resource type, and current inclusions are just redundant.

Dependencies defined in mistral::wsgi::apache are removed and loosen
to avoid direct deference to resources from puppetlabs-apache. When
httpd is used to run mistral-api, the mistral-service tag is added to
the httpd service, so that it is started during service phase.

Change-Id: Ia6edb3f8ceefa4d2480c33aee7893d7f43166eb9
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache

This change removes direct reference to some classes in
puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

- The api class doesn't need access to anything defined in
  apache::params

- The following classes are included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
  resource type, and current inclusions are just redundant.

Dependencies defined in mistral::wsgi::apache are removed and loosen
to avoid direct deference to resources from puppetlabs-apache. When
httpd is used to run mistral-api, the mistral-service tag is added to
the httpd service, so that it is started during service phase.

Change-Id: Ia6edb3f8ceefa4d2480c33aee7893d7f43166eb9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-mistral refs/changes/68/821068/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: it { is_expected.to contain_class('apache') } it { is_expected.to contain_class('apache::mod::wsgi') } it { is_expected.to contain_class('apache::mod::ssl') } it { is_expected.to contain_class('apache') } it { is_expected.to contain_class('apache::mod::wsgi') } it { is_expected.to_not contain_class('apache::mod::ssl') }

commit_message:
Remove redundant default for [DEFAULT] control_exchange

The current default value of cinder::control_exchange equals to
the default value of [DEFAULT] control_exchange. This change makes
the service default used instead of redundant one hard-coded in
puppet layer.

Co-Authoered-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ifd86d3ee30079d310269e7a954719246ec0dcdfd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/04/821004/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Defaults to $::os_service_default $control_exchange = $::os_service_default,

commit_message:
Remove deprecated horizon_* ssl parameters

... because these were deprecated during Wallaby cycle[1].

[1] b2320ac2956ac699fa1caa71d3b13efa77cf7512

Change-Id: I75944413452277257cffce650714894378c18510
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon refs/changes/96/820996/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ssl_cert => $ssl_cert, ssl_key => $ssl_key, ssl_ca => $ssl_ca,
deleted_lines: # [*horizon_cert*] # (required with listen_ssl) Certificate to use for SSL support. # # [*horizon_key*] # (required with listen_ssl) Private key to use for SSL support. # # [*horizon_ca*] # (required with listen_ssl) CA certificate to use for SSL support. # $horizon_cert = undef, $horizon_key = undef, $horizon_ca = undef, if ($horizon_cert or $horizon_key or $horizon_ca) { warning('horizon::horizon_cert, horizon::horizon_key and horizon::horizon_ca parameter is deprecated') } $ssl_cert_real = $horizon_cert.lest || { $ssl_cert } $ssl_key_real = $horizon_key.lest || { $ssl_key } $ssl_ca_real = $horizon_ca.lest || { $ssl_ca } ssl_cert => $ssl_cert_real, ssl_key => $ssl_key_real, ssl_ca => $ssl_ca_real,

subject: Fix name of iPXE efi bootrom
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-12-02 01:14:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic/commit/2890018029a75233e32f6d542ecb64f27fb0be14', 'message': "Fix name of iPXE efi bootrom

In change Ia30aff290ec24972f387612851f8f630ddc9403b
the file in tftproot was renamed from ipxe.efi to
snponly.efi. Later in the filename was parameterized
in change I565e3ae6388812c358e86fac49b17e0cce97b9df.

The dnsmasq DHCP configuration was not updated to
point to use the new filename, nor the parameter.

This change adds 'uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name' to
ironic::pxe::common, updates the other manifests to
use ironic::pxe::common::uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name if
set.

Also add the 'uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name' parameter to
the ironic::inspector class and update the dnsmasq
DHCP tempalte to use the parameter.

Backport note:
In stable/wallaby and older, the default uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name is
ipxe.efi(this was updated during Xena cycle), so the inconsistent usage
doesn't happen by default. However support for customizing
uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name is incomplete and it is fixed by this change.

Conflicts:
	manifests/inspector.pp

Resolved conflict caused by c7966378a036a58018ec0c1155ee6b58f52a49ca

commit_message:
Fix name of iPXE efi bootrom

In change Ia30aff290ec24972f387612851f8f630ddc9403b
the file in tftproot was renamed from ipxe.efi to
snponly.efi. Later in the filename was parameterized
in change I565e3ae6388812c358e86fac49b17e0cce97b9df.

The dnsmasq DHCP configuration was not updated to
point to use the new filename, nor the parameter.

This change adds 'uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name' to
ironic::pxe::common, updates the other manifests to
use ironic::pxe::common::uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name if
set.

Also add the 'uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name' parameter to
the ironic::inspector class and update the dnsmasq
DHCP tempalte to use the parameter.

Backport note:
In stable/wallaby and older, the default uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name is
ipxe.efi(this was updated during Xena cycle), so the inconsistent usage
doesn't happen by default. However support for customizing
uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name is incomplete and it is fixed by this change.

Conflicts:
	manifests/inspector.pp

Resolved conflict caused by c7966378a036a58018ec0c1155ee6b58f52a49ca

Closes-Bug: #1952652
Change-Id: I1b3ccd8ad8f3ce66c66c58b1dfdca158d749c287
(cherry picked from commit 51ea0c95eabe8dd15493dd719b8ee34079ef3bb1)
(cherry picked from commit 2688458cb0eae1b09c50417477a27a8e8dba682b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/86/820086/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dhcp-boot=tag:efi,tag:!ipxe,<%= @uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name_real %> dhcp-option=tag:efi6,tag:!ipxe6,option6:bootfile-url,tftp://<%= @dnsmasq_local_ip_real %>/<%= @uefi_ipxe_bootfile_name_real %>

commit_message:
Add support for the interface parameter in authtoken middleware

This patch adds support for [keystone_authtoken] interface parameter,
so that operators can define which endpoint should be used by authtoken
middleware.

Remove dependencies for Keystone_* resources

... because the same dependencies are already implemented in
puppet-keystone and puppet-barbican is not the proper place to define
these.

commit_message:
Clean up direct dependencies on puppetlabs-apache

This change removes direct reference to some classes in
puppetlabs-apache. Details are explained below.

- The api class doesn't need access to anything defined in
  apache::params

- The following classes are included by the openstacklib::wsgi::apache
  resource type, and current inclusions are just redundant.

Change-Id: Ib925b7e034718d4d692fe49bd0e629820868b3a9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-manila refs/changes/54/821054/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove redundant default for [DEFAULT] control_exchange

The current default value of manila::control_exchange equals to
the default value of [DEFAULT] control_exchange. This change makes
the service default used instead of redundant one hard-coded in
puppet layer.

Co-Authoered-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idab8f85be97b0b3caceda9cbc93b0c4f8b23a7b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-manila refs/changes/05/821005/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Defaults to $::os_service_default $control_exchange = $::os_service_default,

commit_message:
Add support for the interface parameter in authtoken middleware

This patch adds support for [keystone_authtoken] interface parameter,
so that operators can define which endpoint should be used by authtoken
middleware.

Change-Id: I39bf94a041d7d4af31fb2653c9274ee8fbdb732e
(cherry picked from commit 33d690c7eb0cadf2d8782cb67bb2979e223a3f89)
(cherry picked from commit e71b518d68d2dbf8aa93f55b5fe7a9c399d70fcd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-aodh refs/changes/15/820615/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*interface*] # (Optional) Interface to use for the Identity API endpoint. Valid values are # "public", "internal" or "admin". # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # $interface = $::os_service_default, interface => $interface,
